articles.description: The volcano in central Africa devastated the city of Goma in 2002, leaving more than 100,000 people homeless and hundreds dead by some counts.

articles.title: Kaizer Chiefs through to Caf Champions League semi-finals - SowetanLIVE
articles.description: Kaizer Chiefs continued with their unbelievable journey in the Caf Champions League when they qualified for the semi-finals of Africa’s prestigious competition despite their 3-0 defeat to Simba SC at the Benjamin Mkapa Stadium in Tanzania on Saturday.

articles.title: Vodacom consortium wins Ethiopia operating licence - TechCentral
articles.description: Ethiopia has awarded a new telecommunications licence to a consortium including South Africa's Vodacom Group, paving the way for a long-awaited opening of the sector.

articles.title: Mickelson, Oosthuizen share PGA lead at windy Kiawah - SuperSport
articles.description: Phil Mickelson, chasing a historic sixth major title at age 50, shared the lead with South Africa's Louis Oosthuizen late in Friday's second round of the PGA Championship at windy Kiawah Island.

articles.title: Covid-19: Covax strikes deal with J&J for vaccine supply - News24
articles.description: Covax, the Covid-19 vaccine acquisition alliance, on which most African countries are reliant, has struck a deal with Johnson & Johnson.
articles.content:
• The deal is expected to benefit Africa's slow Covid-19 vaccine rollout.
  • The Serum Institute of India said it will not be exporting any more vaccine doses until the end of the year.
